Class PlasmaGamepad

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.GenericHID
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick
        • org.usfirst.frc.team2403.robot.PlasmaGamepad

  • public class PlasmaGamepad
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick
    Handles input from an XBox360 controller
    Author:
    Allek

        public double getLeftJoystickXAxis()
        Get left joystick x-axis (left-right). Full left = -1, full right = +1.

      • getLeftJoystickYAxis

        public double getLeftJoystickYAxis()
        Get left joystick y-axis (up-down). Full up = -1, full down = +1.

      • getRightJoystickXAxis

        public double getRightJoystickYAxis()
        Get right joystick y-axis (up-down). Full up = -1, full down = +1.

      • getTriggerAxis

        public double getTriggerAxis()
        Get trigger axis. Right depressed -> -1 Left depressed -> +1 Both fully depressed/neither touched = 0
        Returns:
        Trigger axis value

      • rightTriggerPressed

        public boolean rightTriggerPressed()
        Deprecated. Prone to looping issues. Use PlasmaGamepad.getRightTriggerButton().get() instead.
        Check if right trigger is pressed (trigger axis < 0).
        Returns:
        True if pressed

      • leftTriggerPressed

        public boolean leftTriggerPressed()
        Deprecated. Prone to looping issues. Use PlasmaGamepad.getLeftTriggerButton().get() instead.
        Check if left trigger is pressed (trigger axis > 0).
        Returns:
        True if pressed

      • getDPadXAxis

        public int getDPadXAxis()
        Get DPad axis. Right = 1 Left = -1
        Returns:
        DPad axis

      • rightDPadPressed

        public boolean rightDPadPressed()
        Deprecated. Prone to looping issues. Use PlasmaGamepad.getRightDPadButton().get() instead.
        Check if D-Pad is pressed right.
        Returns:
        True if pressed

      • leftDPadPressed

        public boolean leftDPadPressed()
        Deprecated. Prone to looping issues. Use PlasmaGamepad.getLeftDPadButton().get() instead.
        Check if D-Pad is pressed left.
        Returns:
        True if pressed
